SEARCH
Module InternationalPokemonTradeTool
Package main.java.tradingEngine.gameData

Class SaveFile

java.lang.Object
main.java.tradingEngine.gameData.SaveFile
public class SaveFile extends Object
This class is used to read and write data from a Pokémon Red, Green, Blue, Yellow, Gold, Silver or Crystal save file. It also detects the generation (RBY or GSC) and the region of the game the save file is from.

    • checksum

      public int checksum

  • Constructor Details

    • SaveFile

      public SaveFile(String path) throws IOException
      Reads the save file located at the given path.
      Parameters:
      path - the save file path
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file opening fails or if the save file has some problem (for instance, bad checksums, illegal data, ...)

  • Method Details

    • getPartyPokemon

      public Pokemon getPartyPokemon(int index)
      Returns one the Pokémon in the party at the given index (0 gives the 1st Pokémon, 5 gives the 6th).
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the wanted party Pokémon
      Returns:
      the Pokémon at this index in the party
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index is negative or above 5

    • getPartyLength

      public int getPartyLength()
      Returns the number of Pokémon in the party.
      Returns:
      the party length

    • getBoxPokemon

      public Pokemon getBoxPokemon(int boxNumber, int pokemonIndex)
      Returns a Pokémon in the specified box and at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      boxNumber - the number of the box the Pokémon is (starts at 0).
      pokemonIndex - the index of the Pokémon in the box
      Returns:
      the wanted Pokémon
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the boxNumber or pokemonIndex is negative or too big for the game / region

    • getPath

      public String getPath()
      Returns the path where the save file is located.
      Returns:
      the path

    • setPath

      public void setPath(String path)
      Sets the path where the data must be written. This save file will not load data at that location, but will overwrite the potential file every time a new Pokémon is stored.
      Parameters:
      path - the new file path

    • getTrainerId

      public int getTrainerId()
      Returns the trainer ID of the save file.
      Returns:
      the trainer ID

    • getTrainerName

      public InGameString getTrainerName()
      Returns the trainer name of the save file.
      Returns:
      the trainer name

    • getLanguage

      public Language getLanguage()
      Returns the save file's language.
      Returns:
      the save file's language

    • setLanguage

      public void setLanguage(Language language)
      Sets the save file's language. This should only be used with a Western save file, since it's the only case where the language cannot be detected.
      Parameters:
      language - the save file's language

    • storePokemonInParty

      public void storePokemonInParty(int index, Pokemon pokemon) throws IOException
      Replace a Pokémon in the save file's party with the one given as parameter. Updates both the object and the file.
      Parameters:
      index - the index in the party where the Pokémon should be placed (starts at 0).
      pokemon - the Pokémon to store
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file writing fails
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index is illegal, or if there is no Pokémon at that index or if the Pokémon is not in the same format as the save file (it must be converted beforehand)

    • storePokemonInBox

      public void storePokemonInBox(int boxNumber, int pokemonIndex, Pokemon pokemon) throws IOException
      Replace a Pokémon in one of the save file's boxes with the one given as parameter. Updates both the object and the file.
      Parameters:
      boxNumber - the box where the Pokémon should be placed (starts at 0)
      pokemonIndex - the index in the box where the Pokémon should be placed (starts at 0)
      pokemon - the Pokémon to store
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file writing fails
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index is illegal, or if there is no Pokémon at that location or if the Pokémon is not in the same format as the save file (it must be converted beforehand)

    • backup

      public void backup() throws IOException
      Copy the save file into the "backups" folder.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the backup fail for some reason
      See Also:
      • SaveBackups.backup(SaveFile)

    • getChecksum

      public int getChecksum()
      Returns the save file's checksum.
      Returns:
      the checksum

    • isWestern

      public static boolean isWestern(byte[] saveData)
      Returns if the save file is from a western game (i.e., english, French, german, spanish or italian).
      Parameters:
      saveData - the save file's raw data
      Returns:
      true if the save file is western, false otherwise

    • isJapanese

      public static boolean isJapanese(byte[] saveData)
      Returns if the save file is from a japanese game.
      Parameters:
      saveData - the save file's raw data
      Returns:
      true if the save file is japanese, false otherwise
